name: countermovement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a movement (= a group of people with a set of aims and ideas) that has ideas opposed to, often in reaction to, another movement: Their action spurred a countermovement on the right. He has energized the youth vote, but he also has provoked a counter-movement.
a trend (= a general development or change in a situation or in the way that people are behaving) that goes in the opposite direction to another trend: Many people are leaving urban areas, but there is also a countermovement with the city becoming a magnet.
More examplesFewer examplesHis actions would help ignite a conservative movement, as well as a liberal countermovement. He broke with the group and formed his own counter-movement. There's been a smaller but significant counter-movement in other areas away from the traditional parties. As well as a fascination with the future and futurism, there is a counter-movement towards the past.
